name: Professional Emails
description: Write clear, professional emails for business communication

questions.question: What type of email are you writing?
questions.description: Different email types require different approaches and tones

questions.question: What's your relationship with the recipient?
questions.description: The relationship determines the appropriate level of formality

questions.question: What's the main subject or purpose of the email?
questions.description: Be specific about what you want to communicate

questions.question: What do you want the recipient to do?
questions.description: Be clear about the action you want them to take

questions.question: What tone should the email have?
questions.description: Choose a tone that matches the situation and relationship

questions.question: How detailed should the email be?
questions.description: Consider the recipient's time and the complexity of the matter

questions.question: How many variations would you like?
questions.description: Choose how many different versions of your prompt to generate (3-20)

templates.name: Professional Request Email
templates.description: Make a clear, professional request with appropriate context
templates.template: Write a {tone} email to {recipient_relationship} about {subject_matter}. The email should be {urgency_level} and {length_preference}. {desired_outcome_instruction}. {variations_instruction}

inputs.desired_outcome_instruction: Include a clear call-to-action for a meeting

examples.output: Write a professional email to new contact about partnership opportunity. The email should be not urgent and moderate detail. Include a clear call-to-action for a meeting

examples.title: Meeting Request
examples.description: Professional meeting request with clear purpose
examples.prompt: Write a friendly professional email to a colleague about scheduling a project review meeting. The email should be somewhat urgent and brief and to the point. Include a clear call-to-action for meeting availability.
examples.result:
Subject: Project Review Meeting - Your Availability

Hi [Name],

I hope this email finds you well. I'd like to schedule a brief project review meeting to discuss the Q4 deliverables and ensure we're on track.

Could you please let me know your availability for next week? I'm flexible between Tuesday and Thursday.

Looking forward to catching up.

Best regards,
[Your name]

examples.title: Follow-up Email
examples.prompt: Write a professional email to a potential client about following up on our initial conversation. The email should be not urgent and moderate detail. Include a clear call-to-action for next steps.
examples.result:
Subject: Following Up - [Company Name] Partnership Discussion

Dear [Name],

I hope you're doing well. I wanted to follow up on our conversation last week about potential collaboration opportunities between our companies.

As we discussed, I believe there's significant potential for synergy in [specific area]. I've prepared a brief proposal outlining how we could work together.

Would you be available for a 30-minute call next week to discuss this further? I'm happy to work around your schedule.

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Best regards,
[Your name]
[Your title]
[Company]
